column4: I've installed another language package but how do I actually change between languages in the OS?
I've installed another language package but how do I actually change between languages in the OS?
in KDE it is in control center --> regional and languages
I have "Language support"
try logging out, then change in the languages under login menu, relogin
:-s ohhh
is the language you want listed there ?
check the menus, are they in your language ?
no, everything is in english, I don't want the softwares/os itself to be in that language I just want to be able to type/search in that language
ah, then try SCIM :)
which language are you trying ?
Hebrew, but it's listen everywhere, I just think I need to enable it somehow
for me, in KDE, if i go to "regional/languages' in control center, i have to install "hebrew" and then bring it to the top of the list to enable it
but I installed it from the synpatic first
what did you install ?
if you have installed font, it wont enable the language
OK i uninstalled the packages, then went to regional/language, it installed hebrew package, now how do i type in hebrew? like in windows that u have en/he for example, and u switch with ALT+SHIFT
thanks, it's now all good ;).
welcome :)
check keyboard shortcuts
